http://java.sun.com/=

Hi,

I have also that problem and=
 had a look at your link.
I ran : cacls jmxremote.password /P {MyUserNameHe=
re}:R
Failed.

I turn off Tomcat just in case.
I tried http:127.0.0.1:8080 =
to make sure no one else is using it 
(conflict).

If I take take an copy o=
f that directory, bring it in Knoppix (or 
other linux), it working fine. I=
 can get to the login screen.

I have Windows XP Pro.

What else can I do?
=

Thanks.

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com <mailto:archive-crawler%40=
yahoogroups.com> , Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> 
wrote:
>
> I run Heritrix of v=
arious versions on XP-Pro no problem, but 
usually not 
> with JMX enabled.=

> 
> However, when I recently did need to set up a post-1.12 development 
=
> version with JMX, usinga suitably permissions-protected password 
file, 
=
> the 'cacls' command described on this page did the trick:
> 
> http://blo=
gs.sun.com/jmxetc/entry/the_hidden_command_that_would <http://blogs.sun.com=
/jmxetc/entry/the_hidden_command_that_would> 
> 
> As the page notes, 'cacl=
s' might not work for a FAT32 volume.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> xdelox wrote:=

> > Hi,
> > I'm trying to run Heritrix 1.12.0 on a PC with Windows Xp 
PRO=
FESSIONAL
> > SP2, but unsuccesfully. I've already widely used the same ver=
sion 
on
> > Win XP HOME EDITION, but I don't remember any problem in
> > c=
onfiguration. I only remember I've replaced the 
jmxremote.password
> > whe=
re need and replaced @PASSWORD@ with letmein in those file.
> > 
> > When I=
 try, from command line, to launch heritrix in this way, the
> > output is =
like the follow lines:
> > 
> >> - Login and password have not been specifi=
ed (see --admin switch)
> >> - another program uses the port for the web UI=
 (8080 by default)
> > (e.g. another Heritrix instance)
> >> - JMX password=
 file is missing or permissions not set correctly
> > 
> >> Do you want to =
try to fix the permissions (Y/N)?
> > 
> > When I choose Y, it returns this=
 second set of output:
> > 
> >> Restart Heritrix (Y/N)?Y
> >> WARNING: It'=
s currently not possible to run Heritrix in 
background 
> > >on Windows. I=
t was just started minimized in a new Window 
and
> > will be >shut down as=
 soon as you log off.
> > 
> >> Either fixing the permissions failed or the=
re was another 
problem.
> >> You may have to set the ownership of the file=
 
> >> \Programmi\Java\heritrix-1.12.0\jmxremote.password
> >> manually to =
yourself (%USERNAME%) and restrict the access to 
>read-only.
> > 
> > wher=
e %USERNAME% is my username in windows account.
> > 
> > I've read the FAQ =
and all the correlated articles
> > 
(http://www.cip.ifi.lmu.de/~schoefma/h=
owto/run_heritrix_on_windows/ <http://www.cip.ifi.lmu.de/~schoefma/howto/ru=
n_heritrix_on_windows/> 
> > for example).
> > 
> > I also tried to modify =
permission in all the way. 
> > What's wrong? Please help me!
> > 
> > Than=
ks
> > xdelox
